title: Design Anomaly Detection Algorithm
description: Design and document the statistical anomaly detection algorithm for identifying cost/usage spikes. Algorithm must handle multi-dimensional data (agent, model, time) and produce confidence scores for alerts. Research existing approaches (Z-score, IQR, moving averages, forecasting) and select optimal method for our use case.

comments.author: ephoe
comments.content: Design document has been created at mcp-server/docs/ANOMALY_DETECTION_DESIGN.md

comments.author: ephoe
comments.content: Task completed. Comprehensive design document covers: 3 statistical methods (Z-score, IQR, Moving Average), anomaly scoring system (0-100), alert routing, auto-task creation, API design, performance requirements, and testing strategy. Discovered existing partial implementation in anomaly-detector.ts that can be enhanced.

criteria: Anomaly detection algorithm selected and documented (Z-score, IQR, or time-series forecasting)
Statistical thresholds defined for spike detection (e.g., 3 sigma)
Algorithm handles sparse data and cold-start scenarios
Performance benchmarks show <1s processing per 1000 data points
